Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division (RPD) erred by failing to assess the risk of torture under s. 97(1)(a) of IRPA
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 97(1)(a)
Application_Facts: Claimant presented evidence of visible scarring, past detention, and torture in Sri Lanka; US report indicated possible post-detention torture
Decision_Outcome: Federal Court found the RPD's decision unreasonable
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; case remanded for reconsideration under s. 97(1)(a)
Defendant_Behavior: RPD failed to properly analyze risk of torture and made credibility errors
Grounds_for_Claim: Past persecution and fear of future torture in Sri Lanka
Legal_Standard: Substantial grounds for believing the individual would face danger of torture upon return
Assessment_Factor: Credibility assessment, risk of torture, evidence of past harm
Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct required risk assessment under s. 97(1)(a)
Credibility_Assessment: Board made errors in assessing claimant's credibility
Evidence_Used: Visible scarring, testimony of past detention and torture, US country report
Application_Basis: Risk of torture upon return to Sri Lanka
Relief_Sought: Grant of refugee protection or referral for proper risk assessment
Governing_Rule: Under s. 97(1)(a) of IRPA, RPD must assess risk of torture
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider key evidence related to torture risk
Harm_Assessment: Risk of torture upon return to Sri Lanka
Cause_Description: Kanagarasa claimed refugee status due to past persecution and fear of future torture in Sri Lanka
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient analysis of medical and testimonial evidence
Evidence_Issues: Inadequate consideration of scarring and country reports
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and unreasonable evaluation of evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to failure to apply legal standard and assess key evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of proper analysis of evidence supporting torture claims
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court in reviewing RPD decision
